fraudDetection.utils package

Module contents

Module: fraudDetection.utils

This module provides utility functions for handling data, such as reading and writing files, saving and loading objects, and validating data schema.

Functions:

create_directories(path_to_directories: list, verbose=True) read_yaml(file_path: Path) -> dict write_yaml(file_path: Path, data: dict) -> yaml write_pickle(file_path: Path, obj: object) -> pickle save_json(path: Path, data: dict) -> None load_json(path: Path) -> ConfigBox get_size(path: Path) -> str save_numpy_array_data(file_path: str, array: np.ndarray) -> None load_numpy_array_data(file_path: Path) -> np.ndarray save_object(file_path: Path, obj) -> None load_object(file_path: Path) -> object compare_schema(schema: dict, csv_path: Path) -> None save_dfs_to_csv(df, file_path: Path, chunk_size: int) -> None get_dtypes(df) -> ConfigBox load_data(file_path: Path, schema: dict, args: tuple = ()) -> pd.DataFrame concat_csv_files(files: list, file_dir: Path) -> pd.DataFrame validate_schema(df: pd.DataFrame, schema: dict) -> bool is_dir_empty(path: Path) -> bool check_data_dir(directory: Path) -> None

fraudDetection.utils.read_yaml(file_path: Path) → dict[source]

Read a YAML file and return its content as a dictionary. :param file_path: Path to the YAML file. :type file_path: Path

Returns:

Content of the YAML file.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

FraudDetectionException – If an error occurs while reading the file.

fraudDetection.utils.save_dfs_to_csv(df, file_path: Path, chunk_size: int) → None[source]

Save DataFrames to CSV files in chunks. :param df: DataFrame to be saved. :param file_path: Path to the CSV file. :type file_path: Path :param chunk_size: Number of elements to write at a time. :type chunk_size: int

Raises:

FraudDetectionException – If an error occurs while saving the data.

fraudDetection.utils.save_json(path: Path, data: dict) → None[source]

Save data in JSON format to a file. :param path: Path to the JSON file. :type path: Path :param data: Data to be saved in JSON format. :type data: dict

fraudDetection.utils.save_numpy_array_data(file_path: str, array: ndarray)[source]

Save numpy array data to a file. :param file_path: Path to the file. :type file_path: str :param array: Numpy array data to be saved. :type array: np.ndarray

Raises:

FraudDetectionException – If an error occurs while saving the data.

fraudDetection.utils.save_object(file_path: Path, obj)[source]

Save an object to a file using dill serialization. :param file_path: Path to the file. :type file_path: Path :param obj: Object to be saved.

Raises:

FraudDetectionException – If an error occurs while saving the object.

fraudDetection.utils.write_pickle(file_path: Path, obj: object) → <module 'pickle' from 'C:\\Users\\arunk\\.conda\\envs\\FraudDetection\\lib\\pickle.py'>[source]

Raises:

FraudDetectionException – If an error occurs while saving the object.
